blog.name: bixbiboom
blog.title: I myself am also Enchanter Pumat Sol
blog.description:
Bixbi, older than you.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Possibly a lesser demon.

Hellenist serving Hestia, Hermes and Chiron.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

#eyesnevershut

what was that word. bunkies? bonkies? idk what that means sorry
summary: Fjord, nervously: yeah, well, listen-- Fjord: --about that... Fjord: let’s just keep it right between the amigos? allright? ...
body:
Fjord, nervously: yeah, well, listen–

Fjord: –about that…

Fjord: let’s just keep it right between the amigos? allright?

Caduceus: …

Caduceus: what part of body is the amigo

——

Fjord, not giving up: –and it will be like, our thing, like we’re bunkies

Fjord: like, we share–

Caduceus, happily: –amigos. like we share amigos!

Fjord: yep!–

Fjord: no.

tags: dunno what shape the rest of the party's story is gonna take
just taking a guess at these ones
summary: dnd is interesting because every character gets to be in their own kind of story jester is definitely in a coming of age story....
body:
dnd is interesting because every character gets to be in their own kind of story

jester is definitely in a coming of age story. and that is definitely very different from fjord’s lovecraftian pirate horror and caleb’s time travel political thriller (?) and beau’s crime story.

title: Mary E. McGlynn on Twitter
excerpt: “I hear that heist a’comin’. Comin’ round the bend. Honey heist, that is. Can’t wait! There’s not enough honey in the world for us! @Gingerhazing @BWalloch @ItsDaniCarr @LauraBaileyVO @Marisha_Ray. @KrystinaArielle #HoneyHeist #CriticalRole”
description: Since my mutuals all seem to be in love with Noelle Stevenson’s new She-Ra series, make sure you don’t miss Honey Heist 3: Tova’s Honeys on Geek&Sundry’s Twitch channel (or the Critical Role YouTube channel) next Friday where she’ll be reprising her role as dwarven were-bear Tova to steal as much honey as she and her squad of intrepid ursine ladies can get their paws on!

summary: Save me from super boredom: what is your super extra dramatic headcanon for next game where Avantica takes on Fjord and Jester...
question: Save me from super boredom: what is your super extra dramatic headcanon for next game where Avantica takes on Fjord and Jester in most dramatic fan serving fashion.
answer:
Oh god so many headcanons! I’ve already yelled about them before but let me bring back my faves!

  • I’m a sucker for Avantika using her new water bending powers to try to choke Fjord and Jester using her ax to cut her magic-eye hand off to save him. 
  • Also, Jester rushing across the battlefield to heal Fjord in the nick of time, even if it puts her right on melee with Avantika.
  • “Thanks, Jester.” “I told you I’d heal you if you started to hurt.”
  • Avantika with her high-ass perception realizing that Jester is the closest person to Fjord in the world right now and using that to try to threaten him.
  • And Fjord, at first, pulling all breaks in his fighting because he is not going to be responsible for Jester dying. He is not. 
  • But Jester is no damsel in distress, so she breaks free and then Fjord goes freaking ballistic and dark and scary on her.
  • But also like what if as the next episode starts Fjord starts shouting for everyone to stop and don’t fight and just talk. 
  • And then Avantika says she will talk only to Fjord —which makes Jester’s nerves shoot through the roof— but they hold in place. 
  • And in private Fjord plays it off as “my crew is just very loyal and protective, and they were trying to watch my back” so Avantika offers him an out: give her the person who did it, and he can forgive the others.
  • Fjord can’t bring himself to tell her, so she guesses. And the obvious choice is Caleb, right? But, again, Avantika is perceptive and she knows Jester doesn’t like her and would do anything for Fjord.
  • Oh! Maybe she asks that he kills the traitor himself, to set an example? 
  • And Fjord plays along, comes out and acts the whole thing out as if he was going to kill Jester and the rest of the Nein and confused but even though she looks shaken Jester plays along because she trusts Fjord the most. 
  • And at the last minute, he gives her a sign, a phrase that is an inside joke between them, and they both fire on Avantika at the same time.
  • Or like what if Jester goes down during the fight though? I mean, I don’t think Fjord could handle that kind of guilt, even if they brought her back. 
  • Or what if he shouts for her to grab Beau and get out with the book to talk to the Plank King, putting quite literally everyone’s lives on their hands. 
  • And Jester is tearful as they leave because she’s terrified the others might die as they are gone. 
  • So while Fjord holds Avantika back, Jester dimension doors to the plank king and makes their plead and then comes back just in time to save him.
  • Or she doesn’t and arrives just in time to see him fall. 
  • Oh! Or what if they are captured by Avantika’s crew and she keeps everyone as her prisoners in a cell to blackmail Fjord into taking her towards the ship wreckage. 
  • Because she still needs him as a chosen of Uk’otoa, right?
  • And Fjord complies while sending everyone guilt-ridden looks. 
  • And Jester is going out of her mind because she’s sure Avantika will try to sacrifice him like she did with Vandrin. 
  • Also Iron Shepherd’s flashbacks. 
  • And Fjord is sure that the moment Avantika is done with him she won’t need the others.
  • So they are both running against time to save each other and the rest of their friends.

THERE ARE SO MANY OPTIONS FILLED WITH ANGST AND DRAMA
